data.question: What is the main challenge in synthesizing dinuclear transition metal complexes as mentioned in the text?
data.answer: The main challenge is that the metal sites tend to be 'saturated' with excess donor atoms around during synthesis, making them inactive in catalysis.

data.question: What strategy was used to construct the MOF-supported metal catalyst FICN-7-Fe2?
data.answer: The strategy involved isolating the binding scaffolds with the MOF skeleton and installing metal sites through post-synthetic modification.

data.question: How does the catalytic activity of FICN-7-Fe2 compare to its mononuclear counterpart FICN-7-Fe1?
data.answer: FICN-7-Fe2 is 15 times more active than FICN-7-Fe1, indicating that cooperative substrate activation on the two Fe centres significantly enhances the catalysis.

data.question: What role do MOFs play in the development of heterogeneous catalysts?
data.answer: MOFs provide a unique platform for the development and preparation of heterogeneous catalysts due to their structure predictability and tunability.

data.question: True or False: Most work in the area of catalytically active transition metal sites on MOFs has focused on dinuclear metal sites.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the site isolation effect in MOF supports?
data.answer: The site isolation effect can be utilized to prevent undesirable 'oligomerization' of metal centres in the construction of dinuclear metal sites, allowing the retention of the open metal coordination environment that is accessible to reaction substrates.

data.question: What was the yield of the white crystalline powder product obtained from the synthesis of the MOF FICN-7?
data.answer: 86% based on the H3bppz ligand.

data.question: True or False: FICN-7-Fe2(Cl) has a lower surface area compared to pristine FICN-7.
data.answer: False

data.question: What does the Fe/bppz3- ratio indicate about the existence of bimetallic sites in FICN-7-Fe2(Cl)?
data.answer: The Fe/bppz3- ratio indicates the existence of bimetallic sites in FICN-7-Fe2(Cl).

data.question: True or False: The catalytic site structure of MOF catalysts cannot be easily determined and controlled at the atomic level.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the main finding from the kinetic measurements of FICN-7-Fe2's catalytic activity?
data.answer: The main finding was that FICN-7-Fe2 is significantly more active than FICN-7-Fe1, suggesting a cooperative effect in catalysis due to the proximity of Fe catalytic centres.

data.question: How does the porosity of FICN-7-Fe2(Cl) compare to that of FICN-7?
data.answer: FICN-7-Fe2(Cl) has larger pores and a slightly higher surface area than FICN-7, attributed to the limited rotational freedom between the pyridine/pyrazole planes and the reduced pore breathing effect upon Fe coordination.

data.question: True or False: FICN-7-Fe2 can be reused and recycled for at least 7 runs without significant loss of the catalytic activity.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the role of the 3,5-bis(2-pyridyl)pyrazole moiety in the construction of dinuclear metal sites?
data.answer: The 3,5-bis(2-pyridyl)pyrazole moiety served as a model to bind two metal centres with one ligand, facilitating the construction of dinuclear metal sites with an open coordination sphere.

data.question: True or False: The transformation from FICN-7(dry) to FICN-7(DMF) or FICN-7(EtOH) upon solvation is irreversible.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the outcome of the 'cross' test used to verify the heterogeneity of MOF catalysts?
data.answer: The 'cross' test proved that FICN-7-Fe2, not the leached species, was the active catalyst for hydroboration, as no conversion was observed in the presence of the supernatant.

data.question: What does the presence of Fe–N coordination bonds in FICN-7-Fe2(Cl) indicate about the Fe coordination environment?
data.answer: The presence of Fe–N coordination bonds in FICN-7-Fe2(Cl) indicates successful metalation on the FICN-7 framework and the formation of Fe–N coordination bonds, suggesting a specific Fe coordination environment.

data.question: True or False: FICN-7-Fe2 selectively catalysed the hydroboration of the ketone group of methyl 4-acetylbenzoate and left the ester group untouched.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the main advantage of using MOFs for the development of heterogeneous catalysts as mentioned in the text?
data.answer: The main advantage is that the catalytic site structure of MOF catalysts can be easily determined and controlled at the atomic level, allowing systematic studies of the structure–property relationship in catalysis.

data.question: True or False: The synthesis of the MOF FICN-7 involved a hydrothermal or solvothermal method.
data.answer: True
